contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox book | name = The Time in Between | title_orig = | translator = | image = [[Image:The Time In Between cover.png|200px]] | caption = | author = [[David Bergen]] | illustrator = | cover_artist = | country = [[Canada]] | language = [[English language|English]] | series = | subject = | genre = [[Novel]] | publisher = [[McClelland & Stewart]] in Canada<br />[[Random House]] in [[United States|the USA]] | pub_date = August 16, 2005 | english_pub_date = | media_type = | pages = 288 pp (McClelland & Stewart), 256 pp (Random House) | isbn = ISBN 978-0-7710-1178-8 (McClelland & Stewart)<br />ISBN 978-1-4000-6240-9 | oclc= 58052004 | preceded_by = | followed_by = }} '''''The Time in Between''''' is a novel by [[Canada|Canadian]] author [[David Bergen]]. It deals with a man named Charles Boatman, who mysteriously returns to [[Vietnam]], where he had been a soldier earlier in his life, and his children, Ada and Jon, who also go to Vietnam to search for him. Although generally called a [[war novel]], the author states that he "[doesn't] see ''The Time in Between'' as a war novel".<ref>[http://www.mcclelland.com/catalog/display.pperl?isbn=9780771011788]</ref> ''The Time in Between'' was the recipient of the 2005 [[Scotiabank Giller Prize]]. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Giller Prize}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Time In Between, The}} [[Category:2005 novels]] [[Category:Canadian novels]] [[Category:Novels set in Vietnam]] [[Category:Scotiabank Giller Prize winning works]] {{2000s-novel-stub}}
